message.name: OPENHD_SET_FEC_SETTINGS
message.description: Set the Forward Error Correction (FEC) settings for ground and air unit
message.field: Amount of video blocks (8 is a good default value)
Amount of FEC blocks (4 is a good default value)
The length in bits of a block (max. blocklength Ralink cards = 2278, Atheros cards = 1550, min. sensible blocklength ~ 700, 1024 is a good default)

message.name: OPENHD_SET_CAMERA_SETTINGS
message.description: Create or update the settings for a camera on the AIR unit
message.field: The index of the camera you want to setup, sensibly there should not be more than 4 cameras
The type of this camera
Width of the video for this camera
Height of the video for this camera
The path of the camera (interpreted depending on camera type. V4L2 uses /video/video0 for example)
Extra parameters sent to the camera initializer

Depending on channel utilization by other wifi networks you may need to set this to a lower value like 60% to avoid a delayed video stream. On free channels you may set this to a higher value like 75% to get a higher bitrate and thus image quality.
Desired frame per second (fps) from the camera

Desired key frames per second. (This is how often a "fresh-new" video frame is transmitted. Lower values mean faster glitch-recovery, but also lower video quality. With fps=48 and keyframerate=5, glitches will stay visible for around 100ms in worst case. You can set this higher or lower according to your needs. Minimum value is 2.)
